Identification_Area.title: Near Earth Asteroid Scout (NEA Scout) Spacecraft

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "investigation" references. Adding missing "agency" references. Description updated.

External_Reference.reference_text: T.R. Lockett, J. Castillo-Rogez, L. Johnson, J. Matus, J. Lightholder, A. Marinan, A. Few, Near-Earth Asteroid Scout Flight Mission, IEEE Aerospace and Electronic Systems Magazine, March 2020.

Instrument_Host.name: Near Earth Asteroid Scout (NEA Scout) Spacecraft
Instrument_Host.description: The NEA Scout spacecraft was a 60unit CubeSat (about 10cm x 20cm x 30cm, stowed) equipped with a controllable solar sail and designed as a technology demonstration of the capabilities of very small satellites for exploring very small (1-100m) near-Earth asteroids. It was one of 10 CubeSats launched by the Artemis 1 mission. Its target at time of launch was the near-Earth asteroid 2020GE, but after deployment from Artemis 1, contact with the CubeSat was never established, and (as of December 2022) it is considered lost.
